AE.Display.Animation.element#

class AE.Display.Animation.element(type, **kwargs)#

Bases: object

Elements of the animation

Elements are the items displayed in the QGraphicsScene of the Animation2d. A group element groups other elements for easier manipulation.

Other supported types are:

  • line

  • circle

  • TO DO: ellipse

  • rectangle

  • polygon

During animation, attributes can be modified with the methods:

  • element.rotate(): relative rotation

  • TO DO element.translate(): relative translation

  • TO DO s:py:meth:.element.etOrientation: Set absolute orientation

  • element.setPosition(): Set absolute position

  • TO DO element.setColors(): Set fill and stroke colors

  • TO DO element.setFill(): Set fill color

  • TO DO element.setStroke(): Set stroke color

Note

The element.convert() method is for internal use upon view initialization. It is normaly not called by a user.

elm#

All elements in the scene

Type:

{element}

Qelm#

The underlying QGraphicsItem belonging to the QGraphicsScene of the view.

Type:

QGraphicsItem

__init__(type, **kwargs)#

Element constructor

An element should be fully determined upon definition, so the constructor has many options for the different types of elements.

Parameters:

  • type (str) – Type of element, among group, line, circle, polygon or rectangle.

  • parent (QGraphicsItem) – The parent QGraphicsItem

  • belowParent (bool) – Determine if the element should be placed above the parent (False, default) or below (True).

  • zvalue (float) – Z-value of the element in the stack.

  • rotation (float) – Rotation of the element (rad)

  • position ((float,float)) – Position of the element (scene units). Only for ``lines``, ``circles``, ``polygons`` and ``rectangles``.

  • width (float) – Width of the element. Only for ``lines`` and ``rectangles``.

  • height (float) – Height of the element. Only for ``lines`` and ``rectangles``.

  • radius (float) – Radius of the circle. Only for ``circles``.

  • points ([(float,float)]) – Points of the polygon. Only for ``polygons``.

  • thickness (float) – Stroke thickness

  • color ([color, color]) – Fill and stroke colors. Colors can be whatever input of QColor (e.g: ‘darkCyan’, ‘#ff112233’ or (255, 0, 0, 127))

Methods

rotate(angle)#

Relative rotation

Rotates the element relatively to its current orientation.

angle#

Orientational increment (rad)

float

setPosition(x=None, y=None, z=None)#

Absolute positionning

Places the element to an absolute position.

x#

\(x\)-coordinate of the new position

Type:

float

y#

\(y\)-coordinate of the new position

Type:

float

z#

A complex number \(z = x+jy\). Specifying z overrides the x and y arguments.

Type:

float
